{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3374338,"name":"Nate B","username":"Crate","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crate/{size}/224537_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T12:30:20.845Z","cooked":"

Hey, when I was at worlds I noticed that a lot of teams used Duracell and MK Brand Batteries, What was your reason for choosing that brand of batteries, and if your team switched battery brands, then why? If your team doesn’t use Duracell or MK what brand does your team use?

Edit 1: changed AndyMark to MK
Edit 2 : same thing

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T14:40:04.237Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":123,"reads":525,"readers_count":524,"score":715.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":464603,"topic_slug":"what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use","display_username":"Nate B","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66038,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"88 Scouter, Builder, CAD captain"},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/1","custom_user_title":"88 Scouter, Builder, CAD captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3374343,"name":"Mark Wasserman","username":"Mark_Wasserman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_wasserman/{size}/9677_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T12:41:17.539Z","cooked":"

MK ES17-12 Battery (2-Pack) – WestCoast Products (wcproducts.com)

Max Lifespan 2 comp seasons by choice then they get relegated to practice robot duty which their LD50 is another 3 years.

We have been using the MK and this year we went to 4awg and SB120 connectors. We charge most of the time on Noco Genius 2A chargers but we also have 2 Noco Genius 5A chargers in case we need a faster charge.

Keep in mind AndyMark is a vendor. They do not manufacture batteries. MK is the other large marker of batteries that FRC teams use. They offer a discount to First Teams. Just call the factory and tell them you are a First team. You can get free shipping if you close to one of their distribution centers and have time to let them ship stock there as part of their stock runs. Otherwise you will pay for shipping.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T14:02:26.634Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":402,"readers_count":401,"score":80.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":464603,"topic_slug":"what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use","display_username":"Nate B","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":15944,"username":"FrankJ","name":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66038,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"88 Scouter, Builder, CAD captain"},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/5","custom_user_title":"88 Scouter, Builder, CAD captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374455,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T14:53:09.454Z","cooked":"

We’ve been using Duracells for a few years now and have been pretty happy with them. We ran into issues previously using Interstate and other brands (even MK had a few bad batches a year or two ago), whereas the Duracells have been pretty solid by comparison.

That said, we still abuse the hell out of them with the high current draws our robots pull, so they still don’t last long, but such is the nature of FRC.

How long would you say the average Duracell lasts like in the long run?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T14:57:04.994Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":344,"readers_count":343,"score":83.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":464603,"topic_slug":"what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use","display_username":"Nate B","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66038,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"88 Scouter, Builder, CAD captain"},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/7","custom_user_title":"88 Scouter, Builder, CAD captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374463,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T15:06:25.038Z","cooked":"

It depends.
We started the season with some new and some from the 2023 season and used both for our first few events, but as it went on we found the older ones were degrading so we ended up buying a few more new ones and disused the 2023s.

That said, not every team will need to run their batteries as far on the bleeding edge as we and some other teams do. The average Kitbot/Everybot/Ri3D team can probably get away with using them for a few seasons. I do recommend having a “rolling” replacement strategy though, so you always have at least some new batteries to use if your old ones start giving you issues. And get a battery beak so you can keep track of internal resistance and charge level.

Also, storage conditions play a HUGE role in battery longevity. At room temperature, a fully charged SLA battery loses between 6%-10% of it’s maximum capacity every 6 months, and that rate gets worse the higher the temperature or the less charged the battery is.

StqI14B1104×510 36.8 KB

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T15:09:02.282Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":331,"readers_count":330,"score":171.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464603,"topic_slug":"what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/battery-beak-frc-ftc-usage?Intended%20Use=FRC%20(am-0995)&quantity=1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Battery Beak - AndyMark, Inc","clicks":5},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/a/3/a37cf05d14c8aa066cf04cbfd0d0f98b53c43b94.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66038,"username":"Crate","name":"Nate B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crate/{size}/224537_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374470,"name":"Jim Barstow","username":"JimB1918","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimb1918/{size}/166841_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T15:10:21.289Z","cooked":"

We use MK ES17-12, they perform quite well. We had issues with several other brands, but the MK ones have been quite consistent.

We treat them in the lab as we would in competition (changing them every 3-4 minutes of hard practice). We rotate through our entire set, not using the same few batteries in the lab. Each season, around December, we do a full set of CBA analysis on each battery, and rotate out the worst 4 to become permanent lab batteries. The best 3 are elimination match batteries. We purchase 4 new batteries each season.

Also, make sure your batteries are fully charged before vanishing for the off-season. Leaving them on a partial charge all summer is a good way to destroy them.

We had used a couple of the Duracells in the past, which performed equally to our experience with the MK batteries.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T15:11:04.881Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":175.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":464603,"topic_slug":"what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use","display_username":"Jim Barstow","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51835,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"M(Code, Elec), CSA/FTAA"},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/9","custom_user_title":"M(Code, Elec), CSA/FTAA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374483,"name":"Nate B","username":"Crate","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crate/{size}/224537_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T15:26:24.259Z","cooked":"

This is only 1 datapoint, but in 2023 we ordered a 4 pack of SigmasTek SP12-18 batteries (for only $100 from Batterysharks!) and 2 of them died so completely that they were unusable and we had to recycle them after 1 season.

Went back to MK’s, haven’t tried Duracells.

Was the swap to 4 awg worth it?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T18:04:07.863Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":211,"readers_count":210,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464603,"topic_slug":"what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use","display_username":"Henry Becker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":38557,"username":"Bmongar","name":"Brad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53828,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5809 Alumni - 2025 Team Lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/12","custom_user_title":"5809 Alumni - 2025 Team Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374652,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T18:17:30.064Z","cooked":"

I think so but we never ran 6awg vs 4awg in similar circumstances. With Krakens on our swerve and running a shooter we were pulling heavy amperage. Even with 4awg we were to cause brownout so I can only think it would be worse with 6. Not a good experiment though.
The sb120 are easier to work with than the sb50 too.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T18:17:30.064Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":206,"readers_count":205,"score":61.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464603,"topic_slug":"what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53828,"username":"Henry_B","name":"Henry Becker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/henry_b/{size}/178553_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/13","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374666,"name":"Zach","username":"zrotert","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zrotert/{size}/203582_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T18:36:41.088Z","cooked":"

My team uses the MK batteries we get from the KOP but buy Duracell ones, mainly since we’ve had a good experience with them and can buy them locally. We also test batteries using the West Mountain Radio CBA-V to see a more accurate capacity rating and set aside the best batteries for comp. Typically batteries that test to at least 16Ah are good enough to get us through a match without browning out, as long as they are charged to roughly 13.3V.

Bmongar:

SB120 connectors

Why not SB50? just curious…

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T18:41:52.968Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":176,"readers_count":175,"score":60.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464603,"topic_slug":"what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use","display_username":"David B","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39555,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"David, Mentor FRC 6004/4795"},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/15","custom_user_title":"David, Mentor FRC 6004/4795","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374673,"name":"","username":"FinIce","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/finice/{size}/270519_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T18:44:08.631Z","cooked":"

We use the MK batteries with 4awg wire

You are definitely able to Brown them out, and we have had more issues this year, mostly relating to bad terminal crimps and connections. Regular maintenance is good in general.

We have been pretty happy with the MK’s overall, we used to use Interstate, but I can’t say much other than we found one from 2017 in an old bot 5 years later and it had enough juice to power the robot on for a good hour and a half idle.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T18:44:08.631Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":54.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":464603,"topic_slug":"what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52870,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Amateur Historian?"},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/16","custom_user_title":"Amateur Historian?","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374676,"name":"Christine Low","username":"SurfGear","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/surfgear/{size}/120560_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T18:46:19.370Z","cooked":"

Take this for what it is worth:
I was told from a reliable source that MK and Duracell are made in the same factory in Vietnam - the only difference is the plastic color of the case and the labeling.

We have the CBA, highly recommend. Along with a “battery plan”, and labeling, testing and keeping records of your battery inventory.

Also https://batteryuniversity.com/ and the book Buy The Book - Battery University

In short: You can have the worlds greatest SLA batteries - but if you don’t properly care for them, they will die. Fast.

Sb120 are designed for 4awg and don’t need swaged open. Also they are meant for the higher amperages.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T19:02:36.779Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":50.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464603,"topic_slug":"what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":39555,"username":"David_IsMe","name":"David B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/david_isme/{size}/196853_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/18","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374682,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T18:54:00.021Z","cooked":"

You can barely fit 4awg wire into a SB50, and not without expanding the connector a bit with a swaging tool in my experience.

Looking at Powerwerx 4awg the diameter is 0.238" and looking at the 1307 SB50 6awg connector it is 0.22", so it doesn’t fit well.

andersonpower.com

ds-sb50.pdf

1079.24 KB

Powerwerx

Welding Cable Heavy Duty EPDM

Heavy Duty Welding Cable for use where maximum flexibility and resistance to cuts, tears, abrasion is required. EPDM jacket rated at 105C. Resistant to chemicals, oils, and acids and is also weather, ozone and sunlight resistant. Gauges 4/0 to 6.

P.S. The diagram on the SB50 connectors shows a larger diameter connector, but it isn’t in the part list. Is that drawing an actual part, and if so, which is it. It would be more applicale to 4awg, but I’m not aware it exists. Just reading it wrong.

image995×325 8.42 KB

edit2: To be on topic, we bought 4 MK Batteries, plus on in the KoP (5 total) this year. They’ve performed well throughout. We did not follow our own battery guide and presentation well enough not using the torque wrench during assembly first time to 70 in-lbs, so we had 2 terminals after the first event that were not tightened enough and could be moved, and so that was our only fix later.

Google Slides","clicks":5},{"url":"https://www.andersonpower.com/content/dam/app/ecommerce/product-pdfs/SB50/ds-sb50.pdf","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":5},{"url":"https://powerwerx.com/welding-cable-epdm?gad_source=1&gclid=CjwKCAjwoa2xBhACEiwA1sb1BIrUTp3s4qp-zQb8x_RzPvEjhJFCJoq6mhdP_Mq01QmerZJJHqlDPRoCL0AQAvD_BwE","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":4},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/7/d/7d8877f5dfe5641b1fd27f73cb85622c8fdd7022.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":39555,"username":"David_IsMe","name":"David B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/david_isme/{size}/196853_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2695,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-battery-brand-does-your-team-use/464603/19","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374688,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T19:03:00.988Z","cooked":"
ngreen:

You can barely fit 4awg wire into a SB50, and not without expanding the connector a bit with a swaging tool in my experience.

Looking at Powerwerx 4awg the diameter is 0.238" and looking at the 1307 SB50 6awg connector it is 0.22", so it doesn’t fit well…

IMO, the main arguments I see in favor of SB50s over SB120s is compatibility, weight, and size.

If you use SB50s, you can pretty much guarantee that in a pinch, you’ll be able to use pretty much any other teams batteries/chargers, or they’ll be able to use yours. You can make an SB50 to SB120 adapter of course, but this adds weight (if you use it on the robot) and is a bit impractical if you ask me. The SB120 adapters are also massive in comparison, which can make spacing things in the robot a bit trickier.

Our team still uses 6AWG, but if we ever go to 4AWG, I plan to keep the SB50 connectors and just expand them to fit 4AWG per the various guides out there on the topic.
